content.description: Two carts, <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, are moving to the right with negligible friction along a long, horizontal track. There is a spring of spring constant <math alttext="k equals 1600 newtons per meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1600</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N/m</mtext></math> attached to the front of Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, as shown. The mass of Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> is <math alttext="m sub A, equals 3.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <msub> <mi>m</mi> <mtext>A</mtext> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3.0</mn> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mtext>kg</mtext> </mstyle> </math> and its initial speed is <math alttext="v sub A, equals 11 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>. The mass of Cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> is <math alttext="m sub B, equals 6.0 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>6.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></mstyle></math> and its initial speed is <math alttext="v sub B, equals 2 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></mstyle></math>. When Cart <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> collides with Cart <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, the spring is compressed, and then the carts move apart separately.
content.question: What is the approximate maximum compression of the spring during the collision?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
